name: Circulation at the Origin
conclusion: For the linear differential equation $\dot{x}=-y$ and $\dot{y}=x$, the origin is a circulation.

steps.statement: We need to show that the eigenvalues of the matrix corresponding to the system of differential equations are purely imaginary.

steps.claim: The system can be written in matrix form as $\begin{pmatrix} \dot{x} \\ \dot{y} \end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix}$
steps.proof-method: Direct rewriting of the system of equations

steps.statement: Find the eigenvalues of the matrix $\begin{pmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}$
Since the eigenvalues of the matrix are purely imaginary, the origin is a circulation.

missing.statement: Show that the eigenvalues of the matrix $\begin{pmatrix} 0 & -1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}$ are purely imaginary.
